title.native: 炎炎ノ消防隊 弐ノ章
title.romaji: Enen no Shouboutai: Ni no Shou

description:
Shinra and Company 8 have figured out the Evangelist’s goal: to gather Adolla Bursts from Shinra and Shou. After learning more about his past from Captain Burns, Shinra becomes more motivated to discover the truth about his mother and save Shou again.

But a mysterious girl known as the “First Pillar” reveals the Evangelist’s master plan to start another Great Cataclysm!

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: หน่วยผจญคนไฟลุก ภาค 2

tags.name: Firefighters
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of rescuers specialised in firefighting.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Rescue
tags.description: Centers around operations that carry out urgent treatment of injuries, remove people from danger, or save lives. This includes series that are about search-and-rescue teams, trauma surgeons, firefighters, and more.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Chimera
tags.description: Features a beast made by combining animals, usually with humans.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Atsushi_Ohkubo) | [Official Website](http://ameblo.jp/atsushi-ohkubo/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSYlewtVNXpHDw24YYP-Gzw)

He was the assistant of [Rando Ayamine](https://anilist.co/staff/96887/Rando-Ayamine) on the manga series [GetBackers](https://anilist.co/anime/132/GetBackers/).
[Yoshiki Tonogai](https://anilist.co/staff/97918/Yoshiki-Tonogai), [Takuji Katou](https://anilist.co/staff/99906/Takuji-Katou), [Takatoshi Shiozawa](https://anilist.co/staff/100604/Takatoshi-Shiozawa), [Tomoyuki Maru](https://anilist.co/staff/106881/Maru-Tomoyuki), and [Kei Urana](https://anilist.co/staff/263766/Kei-Urana) were once assistants.

[Website](http://www.aimer-web.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimer_and_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimer_0907_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCR1zT1s524Hbc85bdvno_8w)

A Japanese pop singer and lyricist signed to SME Records and managed by FOURseam. Her name comes from the verb "aimer" in French which means "to love." She is known for being a faceless voice. She very rarely appears on her music videos and most of her live performances are dimly lit to obscure her face. She finally revealed herself on the August 20, 2016 episode of Music Station.

Her father was the bassist of a band, so Aimer grew up surrounded by music from a very young age. She began studying the piano in elementary school and highly looked up to Ringo Sheena and Utada Hikaru. In junior high school, listening to Avril Lavigne inspired her to take up guitar and began writing English lyrics. At the age of 15, Aimer lost her voice due to over-usage of her vocal cords and was forced to undergo silence therapy for treatment. However, that did not stop her, and after she recovered, she acquired her distinctive husky voice.

Aimer teamed up with the "Agehasprings" group, which has worked with, produced, or provided music for various artists, including Yuki, Mika Nakashima, Flumpool, Superfly, Yuzu, and Genki Rockets. In 2011, her musical career began in earnest. In May 2011, they released the concept album "Your Favorite Things." It covered numerous popular works, including works in various genre such as jazz and country western music.

Married [Masahiro Tobinai](https://anilist.co/staff/146979/Masahiro-Tobinai) in 2023.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1219713270149341184)

Originating from Studio Comet, where he initially worked as a production assistant. He is friends with, and often collaborates with [Tatsuya Oishi](https://anilist.co/staff/103552/) and both [You](https://anilist.co/staff/102998/) and [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/). All three of them worked at Gainax together in the '90s.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1219713270149341184)

Originating from Studio Comet, where he initially worked as a production assistant. He is friends with, and often collaborates with [Tatsuya Oishi](https://anilist.co/staff/103552/) and both [You](https://anilist.co/staff/102998/) and [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/). All three of them worked at Gainax together in the '90s.

__Hometown:__ Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Omiya Koryo High School and SHOBI College of Music

[Profile (One Music)](https://one-music.jp/suehiro/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenichiro_s) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kenichiro.suehiro)

A Japanese pianist, composer, and arranger.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__[Website](https://cidergirl.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/cidergirl_info)__

__Formed:__ 2014
__Genres:__ Rock

__Introduction:__
Cidergirl is a Japanese four-piece rock band under record label Universal J, having previously been under CIDER RECORDS (2015–2016). They made their major debut in 2017.

__Members:__
- [Yurin](https://anilist.co/staff/169465) (ゆりん) – vocalist, guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [Tomo](https://twitter.com/ramu_gt) (知, とも) – guitarist
- [Fujimura](https://twitter.com/moff_P) (フジムラ) – bassist
- Shintani Manager (深谷マネージャー) – drummer and manager (2017–Oct. 2018, May. 2019–)

__Former Members:__
- [Toruru](https://twitter.com/twittoruru) (トルル) – drummer

__Support Members:__
- [komaki](https://twitter.com/komaki1986) – drummer 
- [Chihiro Hosokawa](https://twitter.com/sngk_hskw) (細川千弘) – drummer
- [Yuusuke Yoshida](https://twitter.com/yoshidayusuke) (吉田雄介), better known by stage name Yoshida-kun (吉田くん) – drummer and percussionist

[Website](http://www.aimer-web.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimer_and_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimer_0907_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCR1zT1s524Hbc85bdvno_8w)

A Japanese pop singer and lyricist signed to SME Records and managed by FOURseam. Her name comes from the verb "aimer" in French which means "to love." She is known for being a faceless voice. She very rarely appears on her music videos and most of her live performances are dimly lit to obscure her face. She finally revealed herself on the August 20, 2016 episode of Music Station.

Her father was the bassist of a band, so Aimer grew up surrounded by music from a very young age. She began studying the piano in elementary school and highly looked up to Ringo Sheena and Utada Hikaru. In junior high school, listening to Avril Lavigne inspired her to take up guitar and began writing English lyrics. At the age of 15, Aimer lost her voice due to over-usage of her vocal cords and was forced to undergo silence therapy for treatment. However, that did not stop her, and after she recovered, she acquired her distinctive husky voice.

Aimer teamed up with the "Agehasprings" group, which has worked with, produced, or provided music for various artists, including Yuki, Mika Nakashima, Flumpool, Superfly, Yuzu, and Genki Rockets. In 2011, her musical career began in earnest. In May 2011, they released the concept album "Your Favorite Things." It covered numerous popular works, including works in various genre such as jazz and country western music.

Married [Masahiro Tobinai](https://anilist.co/staff/146979/Masahiro-Tobinai) in 2023.

__[Profile (agehasprings)](http://www.ageha.net/archives/ageha_creator/tobinai_masahiro)__ __Tobinai Masahiro__ is a Japanese composer, arranger, remixer, drummer, keyboardist, guitarist and sound producer working for Agehasprings. Married [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/Aimer-) in 2023.

[Profile (agehasprings)](http://www.ageha.net/archives/ageha_creator/tamai_kenji)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tamaken0906)

Kenji Tamai is a Japanese producer, sound producer, vocal contractor, composer, arranger, lyricist and he is also the Representative Director of the sound production team agehasprings.

__[Profile (agehasprings)](http://www.ageha.net/archives/ageha_creator/tobinai_masahiro)__ __Tobinai Masahiro__ is a Japanese composer, arranger, remixer, drummer, keyboardist, guitarist and sound producer working for Agehasprings. Married [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/Aimer-) in 2023.
